# Announcements

---
# We've been dealing with vectors all along!

```{r}
x <- 1
x
```

--
```{r}
is.vector(x)
```

---
# Making a vector 

1) The "sequence" function: `seq()`

--
```{r}
seq(1, 5)
```
--
```{r}
1:5
```
<br>

--
2) The "repeat" function: `rep()`

--
```{r}
rep(5, 10) 
```
--
```{r}
rep("yo", 5) 
```

---
# The "concatenate" function

The universal vector generator: `c()` 

--
```{r}
x <- c(1, 2, 3)
x
```
--
```{r}
y <- c('one', 'two', 'three')
y
```

---
# Elements in vectors must be the same type

```{r}
c(1, 2, "3") # Turns everything into a character
c(1, 2, TRUE, FALSE) # Turns everything into a number
c(TRUE, FALSE, "TRUE") # Turns everything into a character
```
